channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How RAG-Powered AI Applications Have A Positive Impact On Businesses
item.description: Multiple technological advancements have come in the past two to three years to overcome the challenges in standard RAG.

item.title: The last little bit
item.description: Important hills usually get much steeper at the top. 99% of the training in competitive athletics is devoted to the last 1% of performance. A tenth of a second. The same is true for squeezing the last bit of performance out of a car, a grape or a semiconductor. And healthcare, luxury goods and science […]

item.title: Chinese Investors Helped Save A Strategic U.S. Mine—And Made This American Rich
item.description: James Litinsky turned a bad junk bond bet secured by an old rare earths mine into $3 billion MP Materials.

item.title: What are you thinking about?
item.description: A philosopher can spend a month, a year or a career thinking about one knotty problem. Making assertions, testing theories, understanding how others are thinking about it as well. But this exercise shouldn’t be reserved for academics. What are you working on? When will you change your mind? What can you learn, what can you […]

item.title: 5 Clean Energy Technologies That Must Scale And The Gaps To Fill
item.description: These 5 clean energy technologies must scale up soon. What is holding them back?

item.title: “It seems…”
item.description: What a simple verb. A five-letter modifier that opens the door to discussion. If we state something as a fact, we’re asking for an argument. But seems opens the door to learning and discussion. What are you seeing that I’m not seeing?

item.title: How Do Mainframes Fit In The Cloud Era: A Challenge Or An Opportunity?
item.description: With flexible, on-demand access to vast compute resources, is the era of the mainframe now over? Or do mainframes still have a part to play in the cloud world?

item.title: The Zoom stretch
item.description: There are a lot of structural reasons why in-person meetings don’t involve a break every 12 minutes. It takes too long to stop and start. But those rules don’t apply to Zoom. Screens off! Stand up. We’ll be back in 60 seconds. If it’s not worth coming back, the meeting should have ended already. If […]

item.title: Why NASA’s ‘Lockdown Comet’ Spacecraft Is About To Be Destroyed
item.description: The discoverer of the “lockdown comet” is about to burn up in Earth’s atmosphere, but NASA has an exciting plan for a successor—a next-gen infrared space telescope.

item.title: Important change is systems change
item.description: Willpower is overrated. If you want to eat healthier, don’t work hard to avoid stopping at the cookie jar when you walk into the kitchen. Get rid of the cookie jar. Systems are long-lasting, widespread and resilient. We can push back on them with effort, but over time, the system usually comes out ahead. Once […]
